title: Cleft Sentences & Inversion
description: Learn advanced emphasis structures including cleft sentences (It is/was... that/who) and inversion patterns for formal and emphatic expression.

rules.title: It-Cleft Sentences
rules.explanation: It-cleft sentences begin with 'It is/was' followed by the emphasized element, then 'that/who' and the rest of the sentence. They are used to emphasize a particular part of the sentence.
rules.structure: It is/was + emphasized element + that/who + rest of sentence

examples.sentence: It was the CEO who made the final decision.
It is innovation that drives this company's success.
examples.translation: 이 회사의 성공을 이끄는 것은 혁신이다.

examples.sentence: It was in 2020 that we launched our flagship product.

rules.title: What-Cleft Sentences
rules.explanation: What-cleft sentences use 'What' at the beginning to emphasize the action or thing. They often emphasize a whole clause rather than just a noun.
rules.structure: What + subject + verb + is/was + emphasized element

examples.sentence: What we need is better communication between departments.
examples.translation: 우리에게 필요한 것은 부서 간의 더 나은 소통이다.

examples.sentence: What impressed me most was her dedication to the project.
examples.translation: 나를 가장 감동시킨 것은 프로젝트에 대한 그녀의 헌신이었다.

examples.sentence: What the company did was invest heavily in research and development.
examples.translation: 회사가 한 것은 연구 개발에 대규모로 투자한 것이었다.

rules.title: Inversion with Negative Adverbials
rules.explanation: When negative or restrictive adverbials come at the beginning of a sentence for emphasis, the subject and auxiliary verb are inverted. Common adverbials include: never, rarely, seldom, hardly, scarcely, no sooner, not only.
rules.structure: Negative adverbial + auxiliary + subject + main verb

examples.sentence: Never have I seen such a dedicated team.
examples.translation: 이렇게 헌신적인 팀은 본 적이 없다.

examples.sentence: Rarely does a company achieve such rapid growth.
examples.translation: 이렇게 빠른 성장을 이루는 회사는 드물다.

examples.sentence: Not only did she complete the project on time, but she also reduced costs.
examples.translation: 그녀는 프로젝트를 제시간에 완료했을 뿐만 아니라 비용도 절감했다.

rules.title: Inversion with 'Only'
rules.explanation: When phrases starting with 'only' (only then, only after, only when, only by) come at the beginning, inversion follows.
rules.structure: Only + adverbial + auxiliary + subject + main verb

examples.sentence: Only after the meeting did we understand the full situation.
examples.translation: 회의 후에야 우리는 전체 상황을 이해했다.

examples.sentence: Only by working together can we achieve our goals.
examples.translation: 함께 일해야만 우리의 목표를 달성할 수 있다.

examples.sentence: Only when you take risks will you see real growth.
examples.translation: 위험을 감수해야만 진정한 성장을 볼 수 있다.

rules.title: Inversion with 'So/Such... that'
rules.explanation: When 'so + adjective' or 'such + noun' starts a sentence for emphasis, inversion occurs, followed by a 'that' clause showing the result.
rules.structure: So + adjective + auxiliary + subject + that... / Such + auxiliary + noun + that...

examples.sentence: So successful was the campaign that sales doubled.
examples.translation: 캠페인이 너무 성공적이어서 매출이 두 배가 되었다.

examples.sentence: Such was her influence that the entire industry changed.
examples.translation: 그녀의 영향력이 대단해서 전체 산업이 바뀌었다.

examples.sentence: So impressed were the investors that they increased their funding.

rules.title: All-Cleft and The Thing-Cleft
rules.explanation: These cleft structures use 'All' or 'The thing/person/reason' to emphasize a specific element, often implying limitation or specificity.
rules.structure: All/The thing/The person/The reason + that + subject + verb + is/was + emphasized element

examples.sentence: All we want is a fair opportunity to compete.
examples.translation: 우리가 원하는 것은 공정하게 경쟁할 기회뿐이다.

examples.sentence: The thing that matters most is customer satisfaction.
The reason we succeeded is that we listened to feedback.
examples.translation: 우리가 성공한 이유는 피드백을 경청했기 때문이다.

exercises.question: _____ the marketing team who developed the winning strategy.
_____ we need is more investment in employee training. (What/It)
Only after extensive research _____ we launch the product. (did/do)
So successful _____ the merger that both companies saw increased profits.
Not only _____ she finish the report, but she also presented it to the board. (did/was)

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using an it-cleft sentence for emphasis
exercises.original: The new CEO transformed the company culture.
exercises.answer: It was the new CEO who transformed the company culture.

exercises.question: _____ impressed us most was their innovative approach.
Rarely _____ a company experience such dramatic growth. (does/is)
_____ we want is transparency in decision-making.
